availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Hutchinson Bugg (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, Farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Jane Lowery Bugg. Father of James L. Bugg, John S. Bugg, Sarah Bugg, Nancy Bugg, William Bugg, George F. Bugg, Mary Bugg, and Grace J. Bugg. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Fredonia in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 310a.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 162.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 211.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 440b.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994027, Caldwell County Births, p. 2.
"George H. Bugg (1819-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #34832214, accessed March 2, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34832214/george-hutchinson-bugg.
